document.topic_text: Police cheer up sad elderly couple with pasta dinner Lauren Ready, USA TODAY , KHOU 10:35 AM. EST August 11, 2016 Instead of leaving when they found no evidence of a crime, the officers showed compassion for the elderly couple in their time of need. (Photo: Photo from Facebook/Questura di Roma) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST ROME -- When four Italian police officers entered an apartment in Rome, their hearts broke for what they found inside. They were responding to reports of loud sobbing inside the apartment. When they entered the home, they found Michele and Jole, an elderly couple who were overcome with sadness. Not only had the television news made them sad, but they were suffering from loneliness, as they had not had visitors in quite some time. Instead of leaving when they found no evidence of a crime, the police officers showed compassion for the elderly couple in their time of need. They cooked them a pasta dinner with butter and cheese.
